intro: Ternstroemia rupestris, commonly known as the rock ternstroemia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Theaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. This evergreen shrub typically grows on rocky slopes and in forested areas, adapting to well-drained soils. Its leaves are alternate, elliptical, and have a smooth surface with a slightly waxy texture. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators.
